sponsor.partnerMessage: Adventure Subaru offers respectful and honest treatment to all customers with upfront pricing, trustworthy service, and a focus on safety. Awarded Subaru of America's Retailer of the Year in 2022 for commitment to customers and the community, we've donated over $3.2m to 70+ charities in NWA. Visit our eco-friendly certified facility or website, and follow us on social media for updates.

posts.title: Get The Kids Outside With BGO's Nature & Creativity Camp
posts.content:
The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks in Fayetteville will host its Nature & Creativity Camp for kids 7-10 yrs old the week of Jun 12-16 from 8:30a-12:30p.

  • Explore: This summer day camp helps kids explore the natural world and develop critical thinking while exploring various topics like butterflies, carnivorous plants, reptiles, mammals, insects, and more.
  • Create: Campers will unleash their creative sides, making their own artwork inspired by scientific discoveries around the Garden in hands-on, interactive learning experiences.

The Nature & Creativity Camp is $200 with a $15 discount for Garden members. Capacity is limited, so register quickly HERE.

posts.title: Coler Mountain Bike Preserve Hosts Paradise Found 5K
posts.content:
Race through the beautiful scenery at Coler Mountain Bike Preserve during the second annual Paradise Found 5K trail run on Saturday, Jul 8, beginning at 7a from the Coler Homestead next to Airship Coffee.

  • Up the mountain: The race course winds 3.1 mi and climbs 261 ft of elevation through the preserve's scenic mountain bike trails, which will be closed to bikers during the race.
  • All together: Participants will receive a finisher medal, t-shirt, and 50% off an airship drink at Coler. Want to join the fun without running? Volunteer to are needed to help with parking, aid stations, and chip clipping.

Register to run the Paradise Found 5K HERE.

posts.title: Trailblazers and Bike.POC Host Pass The Mic Panel At Crystal Bridges
posts.content:
Pass the Mic with Bike.POC and Trailblazers will bring together community voices to share stories of history, family, and culture around the outdoors in a free event at Crystal Bridges on Jun 8, from 7-9p.

  • Panelists: Jaclyn House of Good Day NWA will moderate a conversation with speakers from the cycling community like Bicycle Nomad founder Erick Cedeño, Mayor Lisa Gilbert of Elaine, AR, and co-founder of NWA Black Heritage Sharon Killian as they share stories from their perspective as minority riders.
  • Better Together: Presented by Bike.POC and Trailblazers, the Pass the Mic Series features in-person panel discussions intended to bring the NWA community together to listen, learn, and determine ways to better diversify our region’s trails, cycling, and active transportation scene.

Learn more about the speakers and reserve your free tickets HERE.

posts.title: TheatreSquared Announces Lineup For 2023 Arkansas New Play Festival
posts.content:
TheatreSquared has announced the lineup for the 15th Annual Arkansas New Play Festival, a series of trail-blazing new plays being performed on various stages across Northwest Arkansas from Jun 18-25.

  • New works: The festival connects playwrights with a director, dramaturg, and professional cast to process their work, culminating in staged reading performances of their plays. TheatreSquared seeks to give voice to playwrights whose timely and relevant stories resonate with the moment we live in—in Arkansas, in mid-America, and as a nation.
  • First reading: Performances will be held at the Momentary in Bentonville, The Medium in Springdale, and at TheatreSquared in Fayetteville, giving audiences a chance to witness the birth of new theatrical works and relevant stories that resonate with the moment we live in—in Arkansas, in mid-America, and as a nation.

Read synopses of the plays and reserve your Play Passes HERE.

posts.title: Raise A Glass At Downtown Springdale's Bauhaus Biergarten
posts.content:
A little expression of Germany has taken root in Downtown Springdale at Bauhaus Biergarten! We stopped by to see what all the buzz was about, and it was, as the Germans might say, "unglaublich."

  • The team: Combining culinary backgrounds that range from Bavaria to Milwaukee, Chef Jennifer Hill Booker brings an extensive knowledge of European cuisine to the table from years spent honing her craft in Germany, and Cheif Experience Designer Daniel Hintz enthusiastically shares his love for German-American food, drink, and biergarten culture instilled by his Milwaukee hometown.
  • The grub: Beer, bratwurst, and pretzels... It's pretty hard to go wrong, but we really enjoyed the Currywurst and a GIANT Bavarian Pretzel with Dunkel beer cheese! Daniel is a super host and walked us through the different beers if you're unfamiliar with German brews.

Follow Bauhaus Biergarten for more HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• 🏠 A place to gather: Kandler’s Shadow Ranch offers a beautiful setting for short-term rentals, weddings, reunions, and small group retreats, with reservation options lasting up to 5-days for $5500 and access to the 3 bedroom / 2 bathroom ranch house, multiple garden sites, and room for RV’s.*
  • 🧹 Clean home, happy heart! Reach out to NWA Cleaners to get your home, short-term rental, or Airbnb cleaned. Get a quote HERE.*
  • 🎤 Freddyville: Saturday Night Live alum Fred Armisen will perform at George’s Majestic Lounge in Fayetteville on Aug 6 as part of his "Comedy for Musicians, but Everyone is Welcome” tour.
  • 🥾 Trail mix: A new cafe recently opened at Devil's Den State Park called Ridgerunner Cafe, serving breakfast tacos, parfaits, burgers, and more.
  • 🍦Brainfreeze: Andy's Frozen Custard has plans to open a new location in Centerton this summer, with a projected open date of Jul 5.
